parameters.name: App
parameters.description: The name of the application to which the live stream belongs.

parameters.name: DomainName
parameters.description: The main streaming domain. Separate multiple domain names with commas (,).

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: The end of the time range to query. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time must be in UTC.

parameters.name: Fee
parameters.description:
Specifies whether a quota of free image scanning is available. Valid values:

*   **free**: specifies that a quota of free image scanning is available.
*   **charge**: specifies that a quota of free image scanning is not available and fees are charged.

parameters.name: Region
parameters.description: The ID of the region where the domain name resides.

parameters.name: Scene
parameters.description:
The moderation scenario. Valid values:

*   **porn**: pornography detection. This is the default value.
*   **terrorism**: terrorism detection
*   **ad**: ad violation detection
*   **live**: undesirable scene detection
*   **logo**: logo detection

parameters.name: SplitBy
parameters.description:
The fields based on which data is grouped. Separate multiple fields with commas (,).

> If you leave the **SplitBy** parameter empty, only the **TimeStamp** and **Count** parameters are returned.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description:
The beginning of the time range to query. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time must be in UTC.

> 

*   You can query data in the last 90 days.

*   The minimum data granularity is 5 minutes. If you do not specify this parameter, data in the last 24 hours is queried.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: The name of the live stream.
